These Goshi made a living by becoming carpenters or working at home, professions that had been allowed by the domain, and among them were those who became kosakunin (a tenant farmer), although they were upper-rank Goshi and retained their samurai status.

These unsubsidized `Mudaka` goshi made their livings by pursuing those professions permitted by the clan (carpentry, cottage industries) and, amongst the goshi there were individuals who maintained their senior goshi status whilst working as tenant farmers.

sen.j: 明治維新後は俸禄を失い没落した城下士（藩士）に対し、郷士は農地を買い集め地主として成功した者が多かった。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration there were many goshi, who were successful as land owners who had bought farmlands, in contrast to the Jokashi (feudal retainers) who had lost their horoku and become destitute, and there were many Goshi who took a cool attitude towards the Seinan War.

Following the Meiji Restoration, there were many goshi who successfully purchased and accumulated land holdings in contrast to jokashi/clan samurai who lost their stipends and were ruined.

sen.j: 西南戦争に対しても冷ややかな態度をとる郷士が多かったと言われる。
sen.e: Many goshi also maintained a frigid attitude in relation to the Satsuma Rebellion.

sen.j: その後、城下士出身者の多くは郷里・鹿児島を離れ、藩閥の力で中央官吏や軍人として立身を目指し、一方の郷士出身者は警察で派閥を形成した。
sen.e: Afterwards, many of those who were of Jokashi origin left their homeland of Kagoshima and pursued a career as central bureaucrats and soldiers with the power of their domain clique, while those of Goshi origin formed a clique within the police.

Afterwards, many of those who were of Jokashi origin left their homeland of Kagoshima and pursued a career as central bureaucrats and samurai with the power of their domain clique, while those of Goshi origin formed a clique within the police.

Afterwards, many jokashi (outside castle samurai) departed Kagoshima/home towns and leveraged clan links in pursuit of careers as central-government bureaucrats or in the military whereas those of goshi origin formed cliques within the police.

sen.j: また、中央に出られない者は地元で公務員、教師、警察官や消防吏員の道に進むものが多かった。
sen.e: Also many of those who did not join the central government became public servants, teachers, police officers or firefighters locally.
Also many of those who did not join the central government became public servants, teachers, police officers, or local firefighters.
Many goshi who did not relocate to urban centers often pursued careers in local areas as: public servants, teachers, police officers, or firefighters.

sen.j: 戦前の鹿児島県においては新政下で「平民」に置かれた者がこれらの公職に就くことは至難の道であったといわれる。
sen.e: It is said that in pre-war Kagoshima prefecture, for those who were placed as "Heimin (commoner)" under the new government it was extremely difficult to enter public service mentioned above.

sen.j: 昭和20年の敗戦により連合国軍最高司令官総司令部のてこ入れがあるまで、鹿児島県政のこの政治構造は変わらなかった。
sen.e: Until the commitment of the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers (GHQ) after losing the war in 1945, this political structure of prefectural politics in Kagoshima did not change.
